title: Market Structures and Consumer Choice
description: Understanding how different levels of competition affect prices, quality, and consumer options, and developing strategies to maximize value in each market structure from perfect competition to monopoly.
learning_objectives: Identify the four main market structures: perfect competition, monopolistic competition, oligopoly, and monopoly
Analyze how market structure affects pricing, quality, and consumer surplus
Explain the characteristics that determine market power
Evaluate consumer strategies for maximizing value in different market structures
Apply understanding of market power to negotiate better deals

skill_builder.title: Market Structure Identifier
skill_builder.description: An interactive tool where students identify market structures in everyday purchases, analyze how market power affects prices and quality, evaluate consumer strategies for each structure, and assess when government intervention may be justified.
